papers.title: CEPC Design Performance Considerations
authors: In this paper I will commend on the early CEPC design as of October 2014. In particular I will comment on the choice of circumference
number of collision points and target luminosity. I will finish with suggestions to increase performance with minimum incremental cost.
Cornell Laboratory for Accelerator-Based Sciences and Education
The natural next future circular collider is a circular e+e− Higgs Factory and
p collider in the same tunnel. The main Higgs factory cost-driving parameter choices include: tunnel circumference \mathcal{C}
whether there is to be one ring or two
and what is the ‘‘Physics'' for which the luminosity deserves to be maximized. This paper discusses some of the trade-offs among these choices
and attempts to show that the optimization goals for the Higgs factory and the later p
